===Alternative forms===
Appears with [[母]] (2 dots) in Chinese, yielding {{lang|und|sc=Hani|海}}, but with simplified form [[毋]] (1 cross stroke) in Japanese shinjitai, yielding {{lang|ja|海}} = 氵 + [[毎]]. These are however encoded with the same Unicode character – see {{w|Han unification}}.

===Etymology===
Probably related to {{och-l|晦|dark}}; in numerous [[Zhou]] texts {{lang|zh|海}} is described as {{lang|zh|晦}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

Compare the parallelism in Chinese: {{och-l|溟|ocean}} < {{och-l|冥|dark}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うみ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うみ}}.

May derive from a compound of {{m|ja|う|tr=u|pos=stem indicating “ocean”; compare {{m|ja|魚|tr=uo||fish}}, {{m|ja|潮|tr=ushio||salt water}}}} + {{m|ja|水|tr=mi||water}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{ja-pron|yomi=k|うみ|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うみ}}

# [[sea]], [[ocean]]

=====Usage notes=====
This is the most common general term in modern Japanese for {{m|en|sea}} or {{m|en|ocean}}.
